required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial to Evaluate the Effect of the Proton Pump Inhibitor Esomeprazole on the Single-dose Pharmacokinetics (PK) of Oral TAK-906 in Healthy Adult Participants
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Sequence, Open-Label, 2-Period, Crossover Trial to Evaluate the Effect of the Proton Pump Inhibitor Esomeprazole on the Single-Dose Pharmacokinetics of Oral TAK-906 in Healthy Adult Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the effect of the proton pump inhibitor (PPI) esomeprazole on the single-dose PK of orally administered TAK-906.

detailed_description.textblock:
The drug being tested in this study is called TAK-906. TAK-906 is being tested in healthy participants to evaluate the effect of a PPI esomeprazole on the PK of TAK-906.
The study will enroll approximately 12 participants. Participants will be assigned to the following treatment sequence:
• TAK-906 25 mg; Esomeprazole 40 mg + TAK-906 25 mg
All participants will be given an oral dose of TAK-906 and Esomeprazole.
This single center trial will be conducted in the United States. The overall duration to participate in this study is 52 days. Participants will make visit to the clinic during Period 1 and Period 2 in addition to approximately 10 to 14 days after receiving their last dose of TAK-906 for a follow up assessment.

primary_outcome.measure: Cmax: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration for TAK-906
primary_outcome.time_frame: TAK-906 25 mg: Day 1 pre-dose and at multiple time points (up to 48 hours) post-TAK-906 dose; Esomeprazole 40 mg and TAK-906 25 mg: Day 4 pre-dose and at multiple time points (up to 48 hours) post-TAK-906 dose

primary_outcome.measure: AUClast: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration for TAK-906
primary_outcome.time_frame: TAK-906 25 mg: Day 1 pre-dose and at multiple time points (up to 48 hours) post-TAK-906 dose; Esomeprazole 40 mg and TAK-906 25 mg: Day 4 pre-dose and at multiple time points (up to 48 hours) post- TAK-906 dose

primary_outcome.measure: AUC∞: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 to Infinity for TAK-906
primary_outcome.time_frame: TAK-906 25 mg: Day 1 pre-dose and at multiple time points (up to 48 hours) post-TAK-906 dose; Esomeprazole 40 mg and TAK-906 25 mg: Day 4 pre-dose and at multiple time points (up to 48 hours) post- TAK-906 dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Treatment Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE), Serious Adverse Event (SAE), and Grade 3 or Higher TEAEs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 14 days after last dose of TAK-906 in Study Period 2 (Day 23)
secondary_outcome.description: A severity grade is defined by the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE) Version 5.0. Grade 1 scales as Mild (asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated); Grade 2 scales as Moderate (minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL); Grade 3 scales as severe(severe or medically significant but not immediately life threatening hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self-care ADL); Grade 4 scales as life-threatening consequences, urgent intervention indicated, and Grade 5 scales as death related to AE.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Change From Baseline in Vital Signs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 14 days after last dose of TAK-906 in Study Period 2 (Day 23)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Change From Baseline in 12-lead Electrocardiogram (ECG)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 14 days after last dose of TAK-906 in Study Period 2 (Day 23)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Change From Baseline Clinical Laboratory Values
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 14 days after last dose of TAK-906 in Study Period 2 (Day 23)

arm_group.arm_group_label: TAK-906 25 mg; Esomeprazole 40 mg + TAK-906 25 mg
arm_group.description: TAK-906 25 milligram (mg), capsule, orally, once on Day 1 of Study Period 1, followed by a washout period of at least 4 days, further followed by esomeprazole 40 mg, capsule, orally, once daily on Days 1 to 5 along with TAK-906 25 mg, capsule, orally, once on Day 4 of Study Period 2.

intervention.arm_group_label: TAK-906 25 mg; Esomeprazole 40 mg + TAK-906 25 mg
TAK-906 25 mg; Esomeprazole 40 mg + TAK-906 25 mg

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Continuous non-smoker who has not used nicotine containing products for at least 3 months prior to the first dosing and throughout the study, based on screening urine cotinine test.
2. Has a body mass index (BMI) greater than or equal to (>=) 18 and less than or equal to (<=) 30 kilogram per square meter (kg/m^2) at Screening.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. History or presence of alcoholism or drug abuse within the past 2 years prior to the first dosing.
2. QT interval corrected using Fridericia's formula (QTcF) interval is greater than (>) 450 millisecond (msec) or ECG findings are deemed abnormal with clinical significance by the Investigator or designee at screening.
3. Donation of blood or significant blood loss (example, approximately 500 milliliter [mL]) within 56 days prior to the first dosing.
4. Plasma donation within 7 days prior to the first dosing.
5. Participation in another clinical study within 30 days or 5 half-lives prior to the first dosing. The 30 day window or 5 half-lives will be derived from the date of the last blood collection or dosing, whichever is later, in the previous study to Day 1 of Study Period 1 of the current study.

patient_data.ipd_description: Takeda makes patient-level, de-identified data sets and associated documents available for all interventional studies after applicable marketing approvals and commercial availability have been received (or program is completely terminated), an opportunity for the primary publication of the research and final report development has been allowed, and other criteria have been met as set forth in Takeda's Data Sharing Policy (see www.TakedaClinicalTrials.com for details). To obtain access, researchers must submit a legitimate academic research proposal for adjudication by an independent review panel, who will review the scientific merit of the research and the requestor's qualifications and conflict of interest that can result in potential bias. Once approved, qualified researchers who sign a data sharing agreement are provided access to these data in a secure research environment.

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants took part in the study at 1 investigative site in the Unites states from 27 February 2019 to 15 April 2019.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Healthy participants were enrolled in this single sequence, 2-period cross-over design study to receive TAK-906 25 milligram (mg) in Study Period 1 followed by esomeprazole 40 mg and TAK-906 25 mg in Study Period 2.

group.title: TAK-906 25 mg + Esomeprazole 40 mg and TAK-906 25 mg
group.description: TAK-906 25 mg, capsule, orally, once on Day 1 of Study Period 1, followed by a washout period of at least 4 days, further followed by esomeprazole 40 mg, capsule, orally, once daily on Days 1 to 5 along with TAK-906 25 mg, capsule, orally, once on Day 4 of Study Period 2.

baseline.population: The safety set included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: TAK-906 25 mg + Esomeprazole 40 mg and TAK-906 25 mg
group.description: TAK-906 25 mg, capsule, orally, once on Day 1 of Study Period 1, followed by a washout period of at least 4 days, further followed by esomeprazole 40 mg, capsule, orally, once daily on Days 1 to 5 along with TAK-906 25 mg, capsule, orally, once on Day 4 of Study Period 2.

category.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Cmax: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration for TAK-906
outcome.time_frame: TAK-906 25 mg: Day 1 pre-dose and at multiple time points (up to 48 hours) post-TAK-906 dose; Esomeprazole 40 mg and TAK-906 25 mg: Day 4 pre-dose and at multiple time points (up to 48 hours) post-TAK-906 dose
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) set included all participants who complied sufficiently with the protocol and displayed an evaluable PK profile (example, exposure to treatment, availability of measurements and absence of major protocol violations).

group.title: TAK-906 25 mg
group.description: TAK-906 25 mg, capsule, orally, once on Day 1 of Study Period 1.

group.title: Esomeprazole 40 mg and TAK-906 25 mg
group.description: Esomeprazole 40 mg, capsule, orally, once daily on Days 1 to 5 along with TAK-906 25 mg, capsule, orally, once on Day 4 of Study Period 2.

measure.title: Cmax: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration for TAK-906
measure.population: The pharmacokinetic (PK) set included all participants who complied sufficiently with the protocol and displayed an evaluable PK profile (example, exposure to treatment, availability of measurements and absence of major protocol violations).

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) performed on natural log(ln)-transformed TAK-906 Cmax which exponentiated to provide estimates on original scale. ANOVA model included treatment as fixed effect and participant as random effect. Each ANOVA included calculation of least-squares means(LSM) and difference between treatment LSM. Geometric mean ratios and 90% confidence interval (CI) were determined by exponentiation of appropriate estimates for difference between treatments in log-transformed parameters.

outcome.title: AUClast: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration for TAK-906
outcome.time_frame: TAK-906 25 mg: Day 1 pre-dose and at multiple time points (up to 48 hours) post-TAK-906 dose; Esomeprazole 40 mg and TAK-906 25 mg: Day 4 pre-dose and at multiple time points (up to 48 hours) post- TAK-906 dose
outcome.population: The PK set included all participants who complied sufficiently with the protocol and displayed an evaluable PK profile (example, exposure to treatment, availability of measurements and absence of major protocol violations).

measure.title: AUClast: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time 0 to the Time of the Last Quantifiable Concentration for TAK-906
measure.population: The PK set included all participants who complied sufficiently with the protocol and displayed an evaluable PK profile (example, exposure to treatment, availability of measurements and absence of major protocol violations).

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: ANOVA was performed on ln-transformed TAK-906 AUClast which were exponentiated to provide estimates on original scale. ANOVA model included treatment as fixed effect and participant as a random effect. Each ANOVA included calculation of LSM and difference between treatment LSM. Geometric mean ratios and 90 percent (%) CI were determined by exponentiation of appropriate estimates for difference between treatments in log-transformed parameters.

outcome.population: The PK set included all participants who complied sufficiently with the protocol and displayed an evaluable PK profile (example, exposure to treatment, availability of measurements and absence of major protocol violations).

ANOVA model included treatment as fixed effect and participant as a random effect. Each ANOVA included calculation of LSM and difference between treatment LSM. Geometric mean ratios and 90% CI were determined by exponentiation of appropriate estimates for difference between treatments in log-transformed parameters.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Treatment Emergent Adverse Event (TEAE), Serious Adverse Event (SAE), and Grade 3 or Higher TEAEs
outcome.description: A severity grade is defined by the National Cancer Institute Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events (NCI CTCAE) Version 5.0. Grade 1 scales as Mild (asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; intervention not indicated); Grade 2 scales as Moderate (minimal, local or noninvasive intervention indicated; limiting age-appropriate instrumental ADL); Grade 3 scales as severe(severe or medically significant but not immediately life threatening hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; limiting self-care ADL); Grade 4 scales as life-threatening consequences, urgent intervention indicated, and Grade 5 scales as death related to AE.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to 14 days after last dose of TAK-906 in Study Period 2 (Day 23)
outcome.population: The safety set included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

reported_events.time_frame: TEAEs are AEs that started after the first dose of study drug and no more than 14 days after the last dose of study drug in Study Period 2 (Day 23)
reported_events.desc: At each visit the investigator had to document any occurrence of adverse events and abnormal laboratory findings. Any event spontaneously reported by the participant or observed by the investigator was recorded, irrespective of the relation to study treatment.

group.title: TAK-906 25 mg
group.description: TAK-906 25 mg, capsule, orally, once on Day 1 of Study Period 1.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Research Organization shall not publish any articles or papers nor make any presentations, nor assist any other person in publishing any articles or papers or in making any presentations relating or referring to the Study or any results, data or insights from or any data, information or materials obtained or generated in the performance of its obligations without the prior written consent of Takeda, which consent may be granted or withheld in Takeda’s sole discretion.
